Situation1: A minor misunderstanding about weekend plans just arose.
Expectation2: Communicate politely and professionally with customers
Situation2: The customer asks about the delivery status
Story: My phone buzzed with a new message from Alex: “I thought we were spending Saturday together. Why did you make other plans?” My heart sank. I could sense the disappointment behind his words, and I knew I needed to call him, to explain, to smooth things over before the misunderstanding grew. But just as I was about to dial, my work phone rang. “Hello, this is your delivery driver. Can you tell me when my package will arrive?” The customer’s tone was sharp, impatient. I glanced at the clock—my shift was almost over, but I still had to finish my route and keep my responses professional. My mind raced, torn between wanting to reassure Alex and needing to stay calm and courteous for my customer. I could feel the pressure mounting, my fingers trembling as I tried to decide which role to answer first, knowing that whichever I chose, I’d be letting someone down.
